title: 1950s Australian TV miniature
credit_line: Designed by Graham McGuffie, Emily Boutard and Megafun
brief_description: This gorgeous miniature model celebrates the evolving design of rooms we watch TV in and the birth of TV in Australia.

constellations_primary.name: 1950s television
constellations_primary.description: "Good evening ... and welcome to television." Bruce Gyngell’s famous words launched television in Australia in 1956 on Sydney’s TCN9, with the medium finally arriving in the country towards the later end of the decade.

description: “Good evening … and welcome to television.” Those were the famous words of television pioneer Bruce Gyngell that first launched television in Australia in 1956 on Sydney’s TCN9. Experimental transmissions had been taking place as early as 1929. Yet the delay in broadcasting came from heated public debate over what kind of television the nation would have: government-run, like Britain, or commercial, like the US. The result was a uniquely combined service, utilising elements of both. The medium reached the masses just in time for the Melbourne Summer Olympic Games in September.
